ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌ʼ shÿɔ́ʼɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, Yěsô gíŋe ḿbiŋe Kapɛ́ɛnàwum. Mé júʼ ngie aa ndá,
en: When   he entered Capernaum  # 2:1 Lk 10:15 again after some days, it was reported that he was at home.

ngiemboon: aláʼ pú ńcúʼte wó tà ntÿɔ̀gɔ kwò te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ ncwò ndá, Yěsô ne shwóŋo wɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: So many people gathered together that there was no more room, not even in the doorway, and he was speaking the word   to them.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔgɔ ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ńtó, mbà mbàŋa lekùɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b lʉŋé yé, lélɔg ńtó ńgyá Yěsô.
en: They came to him bringing a paralytic,   carried by four of them.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ sẅɛ́ɛ ncwò ndá sẅɛ̌, tà pɔ́ té kuʼu le nyɛɛ yé mbwó Yěsô wɔ́, ńgyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́ʼ ḿpfó pɔ́ nzsè gie e gee tÿǒ ndá, ńdʉŋte ńtsɔ́ʼɔ jʉʼ, á gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie Yěsô aa wó, éfó wó, ésẅíʼi nguɔ wɔ́b né kǔ wé, ńtÿɔ́gɔ mvfò yé.
en: Since they were not able to bring him to   Jesus because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him, and after digging through it, they lowered the mat on which the paralytic was lying.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m na yé, ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ngie: «Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwó gù.»
en: Seeing their faith,   Jesus told the paralytic, “Son, your sins   # 2:5 Jn 15:22 are forgiven.”   # 2:5 Mt 9:2,5; Lk 5:20,23; 7:48

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê gwɔ́ jʉʼó, ńjúʼ, ńkwaŋte lóŋ pɔ́b ngie:
en: But some of the scribes   were sitting there, questioning  # 2:6 Mk 9:33 in their hearts:

ngiemboon: «Nyìŋ wɔɔn shwóŋo lêkɔ́ lɛ? À zoonté Ssé! E Ssé gíle yé zɔ kuʼu lélege menò tepòŋ nyìŋ.»
en: “Why does he speak like this? He’s blaspheming!   Who can forgive  # 2:7 Ps 25:11; Mt 9:2 sins  # 2:7 Jn 15:22 but God alone? ”  # 2:7 Ex 34:6–7; Is 43:25; 44:2

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: «Pi gǎa ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá?
en: Right away   Jesus perceived in his spirit  # 2:8 Lk 5:22; 16:15; Jn 2:25 that they were thinking like this within themselves and said to them, “Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zéŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ngie: “Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú,” kà pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie: “lu ssé ńkaa kǔ gú ńdɔg ńgʉa?”
en: Which is easier:    to say to the paralytic,   # 2:9 Mk 2:3 ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your mat, and walk’?   # 2:9 Mt 11:5

ngiemboon: N ge ké nyɛɛ gẅí ngie, áa ndùmo Ssé tsetsáʼ, mbà mé la ná tʉ̀ né Míŋ Nyìŋ, lélɔg ńdege menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b.» Yěsô zɛ́te pɛ́ʼɛ̀, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né ngàŋa kwʉ́ʼte ngie:
en: But so that you may know that the Son of Man    has authority   # 2:10 Mt 28:18; Mk 1:22 on earth to forgive sins”   # 2:10 Jn 15:22  #— #he told the paralytic —

ngiemboon: «Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a gù.»
en: “I tell you: get up,    take your mat, and go home.”

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńdu ssé, ńkaa páŋte we, ńdɔg ńne ńgee, aláʼ ne ńdíe, á pú ńne ńkʉʼʉ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ. Pɔ́ ne ńguʼte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: «Peg laa zɔɔn ńgyá yɔɔn ntí nò wɔ́!»
en: Immediately he got up, took the mat, and went out in front of everyone. As a result, they were all astounded   and gave glory  # 2:12 Jn 11:4; 17:1; 1Pt 2:12 to God,  # 2:12 Lk 2:14 saying, “We have never seen anything like this! ”  # 2:12 Mt 9:33

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋ ḿbiŋe ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Ngalílîa. Aláʼ ne ńtóo ńkẅɛ́te yé, á ne ńzíʼi wɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: Jesus   went out again beside the sea. The whole crowd was coming to him, and he was teaching  # 2:13 Mt 28:20; Ac 4:2; 2Tm 4:11 them.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńgiŋe, ńgyá Lěvî míŋ Alefe, á néŋe jʉʼ gie mé kẅé ncùb pà Loma wó. Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, pɔ̀gɔ zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgiŋe!» Lěvî lu ssé ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: Then, passing by, he saw Levi   the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office,  # 2:14 Lk 5:27 and he said to him, “Follow me,”   # 2:14 Lk 5:27 and he got up and followed  # 2:14 Lk 5:11; Jn 8:12 him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ megàŋakwò pé gÿo ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Lěvî léjÿó mmó, pâ pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńjÿó mmó, lelÿò gwɔ́ pakẅéncùb, lâ ngàŋa tsẅé tepòŋ. Ntí pʉ̀a apɛ̌ laa nzèm Yěsô tɛʼ.
en: While he was reclining at the table in Levi’s house, many tax collectors   and sinners  # 2:15 Mt 9:10; 1Tm 1:15 were eating  # 2:15 Lit reclining together with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who were following him.

ngiemboon: Pakyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê pie é laa na nùɔ pa Falísáyè, gyá páʼ Yěsô pâ pʉ̀a apɛ̌ ne ńjÿó mmó, ńzɛ́te megàŋakwò pé ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ tá gẅi pâ pakẅéncùb pà Loma lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a tepòŋ teme shúm ńjÿó?»
en: When the scribes   who were Pharisees  # 2:16 Other mss read scribes and Pharisees,# 2:16 Mk 7:3 saw that he was eating  # 2:16 Mt 11:18 with sinners  # 2:16 1Tm 1:15 and tax collectors,  # 2:16 Lk 3:12 they asked his disciples, “Why does he eat  # 2:16 Other mss add and drink with tax collectors and sinners? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô júʼ, ésaga mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, ńgʉa faʼa ngÿòmeffo wɔ́. Nyìŋ ne ńguɔ tá faʼa yé. N ka te tó pɔ́ létóŋ pʉ̀a pie é kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ ée pʉ̀a membòŋo ngie pɔ́ piŋe mbwó Ssé wɔ́. N ka tǒ ńtí pɔ́ megàŋ mefʉa.»
en: When Jesus heard this, he told them, “It is not those who are well who need    a doctor,   # 2:17 Col 4:14 but those who are sick.   # 2:17 Lk 5:31 I didn’t come to call the righteous,   # 2:17 Mt 13:17; Rm 1:17 but sinners.”   # 2:17 Lk 5:32

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, megàŋakwò Jÿâŋ Mbabtísè pâ pà Falísáyè ne ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: «Megàŋakwò Jÿâŋ pâ pe pà Falísáyè kwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé. Ejú ngàŋakwò piŋ te yɔ́b púʼu gÿo mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: Now   John’s  # 2:18 Mk 1:4 disciples  # 2:18 Jn 3:25 and the Pharisees  # 2:18 Other mss read The disciples of John and of the Pharisees,# 2:18 Mk 7:3 were fasting.  # 2:18 Lk 18:12; Ac 13:2 People came and asked him, “Why do John’s disciples and the Pharisees’ disciples fast, but your disciples do not fast? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Tà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé gʉa ńzíŋ leluŋó na nò lɔ́ɔnndá nyìŋ, angàŋ nyé ńnéŋe néŋe, meshǔ pé pie à ně ńtóŋ é néŋe nzyè lêkɔ́? Pâ pɔ̌ lɔɔn ńnyé ńnéŋe néŋe, mbà pɔ́ ge ké pfɛ́ pɔ́ mmó.
en: Jesus said to them, “The wedding guests cannot fast while the groom    is with them, can they? As long as they have the groom with them, they cannot fast.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mé ge láʼ fó mbwó pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ésaʼa yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè fʉʼó.
en: But the time    will come   # 2:20 Mk 13:24 when the groom will be taken away from them,   # 2:20 Lk 17:22; Jn 16:16–20 and then they will fast   # 2:20 Lk 18:12 on that day.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ sẅé ńtsɛ́ lepÿé na nzẅìŋe nzsǒ wɔ́. Nyìŋ gÿo púʼu, mbà mmó nzsǒ sẅé ge kẅiʼi shʉa nzsǒ, lepÿé pú fáŋ.
en: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new patch pulls away from the old cloth,    and a worse tear is made.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ne ńgee ńdeʼe melùʼ tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ ngùb, mbà mé té néŋ melùʼ mie mé nyé ńtsɔ́ʼɔ tsɛ̀ɛ nzẅìŋe ntúʼ wɔ́. Mé lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà melùʼ sẅé ge fuʼ, éshʉ́a nzẅìŋe ntúʼ, mé sɔ́ɔn melùʼ, ésɔ́ɔn ntúʼ. Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melùʼ mesẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntúʼ yesẅé.»
en: And no one puts new wine    into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst   # 2:22 Jn 6:27 the skins, and the wine is lost as well as the skins. No, new wine is put into fresh wineskins.”

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà, Yěsô pâ megàŋakwò pé ne ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼa ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, megàŋakwò pé zye lésẅe metsɔ̀ʼ ngesáŋ.
en: On   the Sabbath he was going through the grainfields, and his disciples  # 2:23 Mk 10:10 began to make their way, picking some heads of grain.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pà Falísáyè gyá púʼu, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Líe jú tá ńgyá! Megàŋakwò pú gÿo mmó gie lepʉ̌ ségè tɔʼɔ légÿo na lyɛʼɛ́ nzse mélàʼakɔ́?»
en: The Pharisees   said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful  # 2:24 Lk 6:2 on the Sabbath? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: «Pi laa fó ńtóŋo jʉʼʉ Ŋwàʼne Ssé gie á láʼte mmó gie fùɔ Ndavîd la gÿo wɔ́ ka? Páʼ á laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, nzyè gyáŋa wɔ́b lâ pʉ̀a pé, ammó gie pɔ́ ge pfɛ́, á té wó wɔ́.»
en: He said to them, “Have you never read what David    and those who were with him did when he was in need   # 2:25 Ac 2:45 and hungry   # 2:25 Rv 7:16 #— #

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉʼó, Ambiyataa gwɔ́ tándá panuŋepwɔʼ, Ndavîd kúu jʉʼ gie mé nuŋe pwɔʼ wó, ḿbí mbelég gie mé nǎa mbwó Ssé, ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná ye megàŋakwò pé, tá lepʉ̌ gɔɔn ngie ndàʼ panuŋepwɔʼ zɔ̌ gẅiin lépfɛ́. Táʼ, afùɔ Ndavîd la pí ḿpfɛ́ tà ńná ye megàŋakwò pé.
en: how he entered the house of God in the time of Abiathar    the high priest   # 2:26 Lv 16:32 and ate the bread of the Presence   # 2:26 Ex 25:30 #— #which is not lawful for anyone to eat except the priests   # 2:26 Ac 4:1 #— #and also gave some to his companions? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «E Ssé la gÿo lyɛʼɛ́ nzse ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ mesoŋ, à lɔ̌ɔn těen ńgÿo nyìŋ mesoŋ ńnáa mbwó lyɛʼɛ́ nzse wɔ́.
en: Then he told them, “The Sabbath was made for    man and not man for the Sabbath.   # 2:27 Col 2:16

ngiemboon: Áa púʼu, tá Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé gÿo, tà mbɔɔ na lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà.»
en: So then, the Son of Man    is Lord   # 2:28 Rm 7:25; 1Co 8:6; Col 3:22 even of the Sabbath.”   # 2:28 Lk 6:5
